thread.title: Palmetto Sunrise: Carly Fiorina in town tonight
thread.title_full: Palmetto Sunrise: Carly Fiorina in town tonight - Post and Courier

author: Schuyler Kropf
title: Palmetto Sunrise: Carly Fiorina in town tonight
text:
Republican presidential candidate Carly Fiorina speaks at a presidential forum sponsored by Heritage Action at the Bon Secours Wellness Arena, Friday, Sept. 18, 2015, in Greenville. Fiorina will be in the Lowcountry Friday. AP Photo/Richard Shiro/File × After weeks of outcry in the community, Dorchester County Coroner Chris Nisbet was suspended from office Thursday after he was indicted on a misconduct charge for his actions in a racially charged confrontation with a black neighbor.
An executive order from Gov. Nikki Haley stated that a grand jury had charged Nisbet “for willingly and unlawfully breaching his duty of accountability to the public” and “for misusing his office to effect an unlawful arrest of a private citizen.”
Nisbet, who is white, had been drinking when he chased down Leroy Fulton, the neighbor he suspected of pointing a gun at a repo man in August. He cornered Fulton with his county SUV and pulled out a pistol, holding the man until Summerville police officers arrived.
Read all the details in this story by The Post and Courier’s Andrew Knapp.
Also today, (if the weather doesn’t cancel her appearance) Republican presidential hopeful Carly Fiorina will be at on board the carrier Yorktown at Patriots Point for a gathering of the S.C. College Republicans.
The event begins at 5 p.m. Fiorina, former CEO of Hewlett-Packard, should arrive around 6 p.m.
In other political news:
Former House Speaker Bobby Harrell says he’ll take his time on paying the $113,000 ethics debt he owes.
Read Post and Courier story here .
Congress is looking at reforming prison sentences. Read The Associated Press story here .
Hackers strike Trump hotels. Read The Hill story here .
Bernie Sanders will address Charleston Democrats here Nov. 21. But he’s doing will with campaign cash vs. Hillary Clinton. Read The Associated Press account here.
Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton lead in new S.C. poll, this story from The State reports
